description:
As a Partner Co-Innovation Solutions Lead, you'll be responsible for taking your understanding of Partner's and Google solutions and using them to identify opportunities to co-develop new solutions that resonate with the market. You'll be responsible for scoping the co-innovation, creating/presenting/getting approval for business cases and working with teams to put in place execution plan. You'll also serve as a conduit (or “translator”) between the dedicated engineering talent from Partner and Google.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
  • 12 years of relevant experience working with innovative and technical products in the cloud enterprise space.
  • Experience in a technical/consulting role for CRM solutions areas.
  • Experience working with ML/AI technologies.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master’s degree in a related area.
responsibilities:
• Define and and execute key product objectives and roadmap for Partner/Google in the enterprise space. Lead and grow a team of Product Managers while influencing Software Engineers, Research Scientists and Designers, along with teams such as Sales and Marketing.
  • Identify and scope specific co-innovation activities.
  • Generate business plan and get the necessary Engineering and Go-to-Market approvals.
  • Execute co-innovation projects in a collaborative way with Partners and different Google teams.
  • Partner closely with other product areas at Google to bring the best of Google to our Cloud customers. Cultivate collaboration across Google through leadership, creativity, intelligence and presence.
title: Partner Co-Innovation Solutions Lead, CRM, Google Cloud Platform
